definitions: footrace covering the distance of approximately 26 miles or 42 kilometers
any long and difficult task requiring sustained effort and endurance
examples: She trained for six months to run her first marathon
The marathon started early to avoid the afternoon heat
The contract negotiations turned into a marathon lasting three days
We had a marathon study session before the final exam

definitions: sweet or dry fortified wine produced in the region around Marsala in Sicily
examples: The chef used marsala wine in the mushroom sauce
We served chilled marsala as an aperitif before dinner

definitions: national anthem of France composed during the French Revolution in 1792
examples: The crowd sang the Marseillaise at the Bastille Day celebration
Athletes stood respectfully as the Marseillaise played at the Olympics

definitions: area of low-lying land that is flooded in wet seasons and typically remains waterlogged
examples: Birds nested in the reeds growing throughout the marsh
The salt marsh protected the coast from storm damage

definitions: federal or local law enforcement officer with specific jurisdiction or duties
person who arranges or directs ceremonies, parades, or other organized events
examples: The federal marshall served the warrant at dawn
Fire marshalls inspected the building for safety violations
The parade marshall kept all the floats moving on schedule
She served as marshall for the graduation ceremony procession

definitions: hypothetical or fictional being from the planet Mars
anything pertaining to or characteristic of the planet Mars
examples: The science fiction novel featured friendly Martians visiting Earth
Children dressed as green Martians for the costume party
Scientists studied the Martian atmosphere using satellite data
The rover photographed the rocky Martian landscape in detail

definitions: political and economic theory developed by Karl Marx advocating class struggle and revolutionary change to establish a classless society
examples: Students debated the principles of Marxism in their political theory class
The professor wrote extensively about Marxism and its influence on modern socialism

definitions: person who advocates or follows the political and economic theories of Karl Marx
examples: The Marxist scholar analyzed capitalism through the lens of class struggle
Several Marxist parties competed in the national elections that year

definitions: dough made from corn flour used in Latin American cooking for tortillas and tamales
examples: She pressed the masa into flat circles for making tortillas
Fresh masa produces the best texture for homemade tamales

definitions: member of a semi-nomadic ethnic group inhabiting Kenya and northern Tanzania
examples: The Masai warrior performed a traditional jumping dance
Masai communities maintain their cattle-herding traditions despite modernization

definitions: skilled worker who builds with stone, brick, or concrete blocks
examples: The mason carefully laid each brick to create a sturdy wall
We hired an experienced mason to repair the chimney

definitions: craft or occupation of building with stone, brick, or concrete blocks
examples: The ancient masonry has withstood centuries of weathering
He learned masonry techniques from his grandfather who built houses

definitions: Christian ceremony commemorating Jesus washing the disciples' feet, observed on Thursday before Easter
examples: The church held a special Maundy Thursday service with foot washing
Maundy money is traditionally distributed by British monarchs on this day

definitions: native or inhabitant of Mauritania, a country in northwest Africa
examples: The Mauritanian ambassador addressed the United Nations assembly
Many Mauritanians speak both Arabic and French fluently

definitions: native or inhabitant of Mauritius, an island nation in the Indian Ocean
examples: The Mauritian chef specialized in fusion cuisine from her homeland
Mauritian culture reflects African, Indian, Chinese, and French influences

definitions: bolt-action rifle designed by German Mauser company, widely used in military applications
examples: The vintage Mauser rifle was displayed in the military museum
Hunters prized the Mauser for its accuracy and reliability

definitions: short statement expressing a general truth, fundamental principle, or rule of conduct
examples: His favorite maxim was honesty is the best policy
The teacher wrote inspirational maxims on the classroom board daily

definitions: member of the indigenous people of Mexico and Central America who developed an advanced pre-Columbian civilization
examples: Maya astronomers created remarkably accurate calendars centuries ago
The Maya built impressive pyramids throughout the Yucatan Peninsula

definitions: pertaining to the Maya people, their language, culture, or ancient civilization
examples: Archaeologists discovered new Mayan ruins deep in the jungle
She studied Mayan hieroglyphics to understand their writing system

definitions: international radio distress signal used by ships and aircraft in grave danger
examples: The pilot transmitted a mayday call when both engines failed
Coast guard responded immediately to the yacht's mayday signal

definitions: megabit, a unit of digital information equal to one million bits
examples: The internet connection speed was measured at 100 Mbit per second
Downloading the file required transferring several hundred Mbit of data

definitions: practice of making accusations of disloyalty or subversion without proper evidence, named after Senator Joseph McCarthy
examples: The film depicted the damage caused by McCarthyism in the 1950s
McCarthyism destroyed many careers through unfounded communist accusations

definitions: megaelectronvolt, a unit of energy used in particle physics equal to one million electronvolts
examples: The particle accelerator generated beams with energies exceeding 500 MeV
Cosmic rays were detected with energies measured in MeV

definitions: alcoholic beverage created by fermenting honey with water, sometimes with fruits or spices
examples: Vikings traditionally drank mead during their celebrations and feasts
The meadery offered tastings of different flavored meads

definitions: holy city of Islam in Saudi Arabia, birthplace of Muhammad
place that attracts many people with a particular interest
examples: Muslims face toward Mecca when they pray five times daily
Millions of pilgrims travel to Mecca for the annual hajj
Silicon Valley became a mecca for technology entrepreneurs and innovators
The vintage record store was a mecca for serious collectors

definitions: figure in Greek mythology known as a sorceress who helped Jason obtain the Golden Fleece
examples: The play portrayed Medea as a complex tragic character
In mythology, Medea used her magical powers for both love and revenge

definitions: United States federal and state program providing health coverage to low-income individuals and families
examples: She qualified for Medicaid coverage after losing her job
The clinic accepted both private insurance and Medicaid patients

definitions: United States federal health insurance program primarily for people aged 65 and older
examples: His Medicare benefits began when he turned sixty-five last month
The hospital billing department processed her Medicare claim

definitions: large sea surrounded by Europe, Africa, and Asia, or the region around it
examples: Cruise ships sailed across the Mediterranean stopping at various ports
The Mediterranean climate produces ideal conditions for growing olives

definitions: gorgon in Greek mythology with snakes for hair whose gaze turned people to stone
free-swimming sexual phase in the life cycle of jellyfish
examples: Perseus defeated Medusa by looking at her reflection in his shield
The museum displayed an ancient sculpture depicting Medusa's terrifying face
Marine biologists studied the medusa stage of the jellyfish lifecycle
Thousands of medusa forms drifted with the ocean current

definitions: relating to the principles of heredity discovered by Gregor Mendel involving dominant and recessive traits
examples: The pea plants exhibited classic Mendelian inheritance patterns
Medical students learned about Mendelian genetics in their first year

definitions: member of a Protestant denomination emphasizing adult baptism, pacifism, and simple living
examples: The Mennonite community operated a successful farmers market
Many Mennonites maintain traditional practices like plain dress

definitions: seven or nine-branched candelabrum used in Jewish worship, especially during Hanukkah
examples: They lit the menorah each night during the eight days of Hanukkah
The ancient temple menorah had seven branches representing creation

definitions: international organization for people with IQ scores in the top two percent of the population
examples: She joined Mensa after scoring exceptionally high on the qualifying test
The local Mensa chapter organized monthly puzzle-solving meetings

definitions: person who deals in textiles, especially expensive fabrics like silk and velvet
examples: The medieval mercer imported fine silks from distant lands
Historic mercers' guilds controlled the quality of fabric sold

definitions: heavy silver-white metallic element that is liquid at room temperature
smallest planet in the solar system and closest to the sun
Roman god of commerce, communication, and travelers, equivalent to Greek Hermes
examples: The thermometer contained mercury that expanded with temperature changes
Mercury exposure can cause serious health problems in humans
Mercury completes its orbit around the sun in just 88 days
The spacecraft transmitted detailed images of Mercury's cratered surface
Ancient Romans prayed to Mercury for safe travels and profitable trade
The statue depicted Mercury with his winged sandals and staff

definitions: imaginary line on Earth's surface running from North to South pole
highest point reached by a celestial body in its apparent daily course
examples: The prime meridian passes through Greenwich, England at zero degrees
Ships use meridians to calculate their exact position at sea
The sun reached its meridian at noon casting the shortest shadows
Astronomers tracked when stars crossed the celestial meridian

definitions: wizard and advisor to King Arthur in Arthurian legend
small fierce falcon found across the northern hemisphere
examples: Merlin used his magic to help young Arthur become king
The story described Merlin's prophecies about Britain's future
The merlin swooped down to catch small birds in flight
Birdwatchers spotted a merlin perched on the fence post

definitions: dark blue-colored wine grape variety used to make red wine
examples: The vineyard produced an excellent merlot with hints of plum
She ordered a glass of merlot to pair with her steak

definitions: mythical male creature with the upper body of a man and tail of a fish
examples: Folklore described the merman living in an underwater palace
The children's book featured a friendly merman who helped sailors

definitions: isolated flat-topped hill with steep sides found in arid regions
examples: Native Americans built their pueblo on top of the mesa
The mesa rose dramatically from the surrounding desert landscape
